Reviews.Title: “review”
Reviews.Author: Paride86 Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: the rooms are very clean,the shower is fantastic, the breakfast is huge, the price is affordable, and the hotel is well positioned, near Vicotira Station and the bus number 24 stops outside the hotel, and it is very confortable; every day they clean the room; there's a very friendly domestic staff. Only, the rooms aren't very large, but i think it's negligible if you don't stay all the day in the room. But London is fantastic, and you will not stay so much in your room, guaranteed ;) !!

Reviews.Title: “Oh my Lordy !!!”
Reviews.Author: BarryLawrenson
Reviews.Content: Worst "hotel" ....EVER Even for £65 per night in London  I would prefer to sleep under the arches with tramps and down and outs than visit this place again.. Pointless to list all the reasons as if my comments so far are not helpful then take your chances :-) The building work was not an issue either , It probably masked the state of the place with its ingrained neglect. It was quite refreshing to once go back in time to a place were health and safety was flouted with such regard as a 1950,s Turkish jail .. Breakfast included is funny and I was at least amused at the stretch of the term  " continental ".....!!!! Toast and jam with cereal in a bunker which hardened truck drivers might think a tad tacky. And the addition of yogurt pots happily fermenting on a table in a hot room made me consider the only thing missing would be a poorly tummy to make this visit complete :-) On a positive note it did have all the windows in and a newly opened toilet roll.

Reviews.Title: “Good service”
Reviews.Author: 45-nomad
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at several hotels on this street, this one has a good size washroom (not one of those all in one toilet/shower/sink rooms). The double room on the ground floor is a good size, has a flat screen tv with more channels than other hotels on the street (for those of you who are late night tv watchers) and free wifi. The service was very good, friendly and helpful. It's just a few minutes walk to Victoria train station, metro and coach station. As a frequent traveller to London, I would return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel we have ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: Valerie8969
Reviews.Content: We stayed in October, 2011 in the smallest room we have ever seen in a hotel. The sink was cracked and there was no hot water. The Breakfast Room was not large enough for everyone to be seated and it was impossible to reach the food - not a good start to the day! Only good point was its convenience with a bus stop right outside the door. Apart from this redeeming point, I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Small but cosy Room.”
Reviews.Author: Nikkay R
Reviews.Content: My partner and i booked a room via laterooms.com. After coming to tripadviser after booking we was a little worried due to the negative reviews. We went anyway, The reception was lovely with very nice staff who offered to show us anywhere in london! She then checked us in and told us where our room was and about breakfast. We were put in room 14 on the first floor. the room was beautiful, clean and very well presented. the bathroom was not big but big enough. the shower was a power shower too. the only downfall was that the drain in the shower was very slow the tray got full quickly. In the room we had a hairdryer, kettle, cups, glasses and tea and coffee. We also had a balcony with double doors from our room. We were very pleased with our stay. It was lovely. we will deffinatly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Too much for just a roof”
Reviews.Author: Chi2309
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. If you are looking for a roof and nothing else this is your place. Starting with the good: nice people ( owners and workers), there's a bed and bathroom... Now the bad: hotel was still in constuction, in the room the bathroom door wouldn't stay closed, no hangers, one towel for each person. Worse things: bed sheets were filled with blood stains. Extra note the continental breakfast has nothing of continental, u get bad toast and watered down carbon taste coffe. Not booking here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay if you only want a place to sleep.”
Reviews.Author: Nikki010507
Reviews.Content: Newly refurbished. Have changed alot from photos. Very clean and tidy. Only basics in rooms no fridge! Rooms are small but cosy!

Reviews.Title: “Mostly good.”
Reviews.Author: TykeTraveller1987
Reviews.Content: We (me and my Mum, travelling for Chelsea Flower Show) had booked at the King William IV but due to the hotel's error the booking was lost. However the very helpful gentleman at the King William sorted it out and we ended up at the Lidos. What was good: - refitted shower room, very nicely done, big shower. - The room had 2 double beds and little else but for London and the price it was good. - clean and comfortable - good location - nice Italian restaurant just around the corner - reception staff very very good What was bad: - breakfast - poky basement room, limited choice - noisy road - take ear plugs

Reviews.Title: “Newly refurbed room beats the bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: Monty2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a Sunday night expecting the worst after all the reviews and photos we had seen. We needed a cheap hotel with a great location, so we were pleasantly surprised when we heard our room was "really nice" according to the front desk guy. By the time we climbed 4 flights of stairs, we were hoping he was right! Although there was carpet rolled up in the reception area, most of the hotel looks to have improved in comparison to what we had read. Although perhaps there is still some finishing touches to be achieved. The room was recently decorated with a new bathroom, and although small, was perfectly adequate. That being said, it was big enough to swing a cat! The windows were velux, so there was no great view but plenty of fresh air. A hairdryer was provided along with tea and coffee (only powdered milk unfortunatly). We didn't attend breakfast so can't comment on whether that has improved also. Check out time was quite early at 1030, but at least this enabled us to get out and about. We were really happy that we could leave our bags at reception to avoid lugging them around London all day, as our transport was later on. All in all, we would stay again as for the low price it is great value!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but not too cheerfull”
Reviews.Author: sowingdebbie
Reviews.Content: A positive is that it was getting done up and was undergoing renovations but on the floor we were staying there was no carpet, and we had to walk up about four flights of stairs. The 'breakfast was tesco bread toasted and cereal which is possibly the worst breakfast I've ever had. This hotel is cheap the hotel staff are nice the rooms are clean and a decent size but they should probably close it till the renovations are done and they need to put some sound proofing in as you can hear every door opening and closing. Its also a good location probably wouldnt stay here again to be honest.

Reviews.Title: “A very good and safe place”
Reviews.Author: Luna201107
Reviews.Content: The BeB is in a safe point, a ten minut from Victoria Station. The BeB is very welcoming, the personnel is always nice and cordial. The room is hot, spaciuus, with a private bathroom, restructured and with a news tv. In the BeB each day there are the room cleaning with the exchange of the dirty towel withcleane ones. The BeB is a good place for who search a safe place to sleep. ( I was in room number 12 ,in Lidios 1 )

Reviews.Title: “New room, small, clean, OK, waterpressure low, reception OK, breakfast almost nothing”
Reviews.Author: Arbox
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the weekend of 17 decembre 2010. OK: Room + bathroom was new on top floor of hotel. Room + bathroom was ok, clean, working heating, Watertemperaturecontrol works, bed for two persons. Reception guy (I think the manager) was a very kind man Could be better: Water pressure was very low, so taking a shower took 20 minutes. Breakfast; only toast... People who aren't able to walk stairs / have a wheelchair ; DON't visit this hotel

Reviews.Title: “I don`t recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: JuneHB_10
Reviews.Content: We where a family with one 18 year old and two smaller children. Ordered a room for 5 people, the room was crowded with beds, the beds where clean but 2 of them had very bad matresses. The room was placed in the basement, it had a carpet on the floor that was not very clean. The bathroom was very very small, its just like the once you expect in a ship and a little bit worse than that. The hair dryer was broken, it was almost melted at in use it was almost burning!! The most disappointing about the stay was that the desk manager where very rude when i made thee complaint. I overheard other people complaining about broken windows etc. he was not polite to them either. The other staff was nice. I am aware that the hotel is beeing refurbished but still they could easily fix the things that were broken and even better dont be RUDE when the guests make a complaint! The locatin is fantastic near to Wictoria station an bus number 24 that drives to Trafalgar square and stops right outside the hotel. There are many other hotels in the same street so i would advise you to check out other hotels in Belgrave Road, and not use this one!

Reviews.Title: “disgusting”
Reviews.Author: tonyh9684
Reviews.Content: BEWARE EVERYBODY. THIS HOTEL IS DISGUSTING. arrived after travelling 5 hours and 200 miles to be told no room was available as booked but offered us a room that was being refurbished. the room had been plastered the same day so was very damp. no carpets or curtains or furniture, just a bed with dirty sheets on it. en suite was just a hole in the floor as the toilet and shower had not been refitted yet. the door did not lock either. owner offered to discount the room and claimed the room was suitable for use. he was very ignorant and unhelpful but his friend who was at reception said sorry and looked very embarrassed. we booked into another hotel but this spoiled our whole holiday and cost us more to book somewhere else. this hotel is a disgrace and should not be allowed to take bookings while in this state.

Reviews.Title: “DIY HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: Luffy1643
Reviews.Content: These are the bare bones basic 'FACTS' (not opinions as such) as to how my stay at the Lidos hotel went... in chronological order Checked in, the reception took the payment straight away The owner (who made my female guest feel very upset by making comments on who he thought she looked like) then informed me to talk to the cleaner to get my key. On going up to the room I then learned that the hotel was in refurbishment and had to climb over lots of items left in the hallways and was not made aware that the hotel was in refurbishment. I then asked the cleaner for the key - and she just let me in - and didn't even give me a key. Then the room, the room was very small - width - just fitted 2 single beds across - the length - about 1.5 meters filled up with a refrigerator and small wardrobe - no storage space for bags - i had to put my suitcase in the small wardrobe to ensure i didn't fill up the floor space (the suitcase totally filled the wardrobe). On arrival into the room - we found a chocolate bar still in the desk drawer and we found we had no milk in either the fridge or on the side by the kettle. I then asked for milk - the response was 'in a minute' and then i was given coffee Whitener! it was then I went to the shop and bought my own fresh milk and coffee. The fridge took up space and inadvertently heated up the room. The shower and bathroom size - couldn't even stretch 2 full arms out anywhere without hitting the side walls. We went out for 1 hour and came back and I asked for a key to my room which i had not yet received and he reluctantly gave me a spare key to the room that I had paid for. I then got ready to go out and see Mamma Mia. I asked for an ironing board - the response was - 'in a minute' and I was then given an ironing board with NO cover and the board could barely fit in my room and a very cheap iron that was scoldered and not very good. I resorted to using a towel as a iron board cover. On day 2 of the stay we decided not to have breakfast due to the cleanliness and poor service attitude of the hotel. We went out all day and came back to find that our bins were not emptied - bedding not changed and towels not changed and no cleaning had taken place. After the 2nd night and checking out in the morning we were allowed to leave our bags in holding - we came back to our bags on departure for London to find that the hotel voluntarily moved our bags from an unsecured lobby in the hotel into another unsecured lobby in the hotel and the owner didn't apologise for the temporary discomfort that we faced as a result of speculating that our bags may have been taken or moved without our permission. As you can see - there are very little opinions here - I have included as many facts here in order for you to know what happend in the hotel. My opinion is - that many BASICS here were not covered, milk, ironing board, customer service, bin clean, towels, bedding, clean room etc etc.... seemed like when they had my money - That was it - get it yourself! - that's my opinion to which I WILL NOT be judged on this trip advisor review. The location of London Victoria, Belgrave Road was nice clean and fairly quiet for central London.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a nightmare!! the worse hotel at the other side of the atlantic”
Reviews.Author: Nivardo
Reviews.Content: no WIFI unless you pay to other hotel for it (if you stay at the other hotel WIFI is free) no Air conditioning or even a FAN, so at night it was very hot no matter how cold it was in the outside. Staff was rude and barely speak english (they are from somewhere in middle east). TV does not work and it was old an small. The Bathroom was a combination of an aiplane toilet with an shower added. Terrible! also it was to expensive for what they gave, and you have to pay once you arrive, you cannot pay in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Don't judge a hotel by it's reviews!”
Reviews.Author: hgraham03
Reviews.Content: Don't be put off by what other people are saying about this hotel. I am a twenty year old student that wanted a trip to London as cheap as I could make it possible. Although very small and basic, the rooms had everything we needed. It was sufficient for the little time we actually spent in the hotel. Perfect Location. Clean, and a very good nights sleep. Breakfast basic, but what can you expect for free?!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here! Dirty, cold and needing a massive refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: AlisonSouthampton
Reviews.Content: The hotel was dirty and old and I would not recommend it to anyone! We were lead through an old kitchen to our room (two hotels had been joined into one and the access to the second one was through a kitchen) which was inadequet to say the least. There was no heating, the thermostate was missing from the radiator, the hot water took so long to warm up that in the morning my husband had a cold shower. The windows were metal framed and drafty and with sheets and 3 blankets, we were still very cold. (extra blanket obtained from the Reception) The pillow case had blood stains on it and the blankets didn't look very clean. I am sure the bathroom would not have met any kind of standards, the shower head looked like it had never been cleaned and we were not sure if we should even use it. The bathroom was very small with a light hanging from the ceiling, out of it's socket and lino on the floor, curling 5inches up the wall with big rips in it. The staff were friendly and tried to help, when I asked to move rooms, I was told they would move me if they had room, but were full. They did explain that the rooms in the newly obtained hotel wing were not upto the standards of those in the main hotel. We did not make breakfast as we didn't fancy eating anything from there. On complaining to the Manager in the morning, we were given some discount, but would definatley not recommend this hotel to anyone unless you can guarantee to be in the main hotel.

Reviews.Title: “appalling”
Reviews.Author: marcoUk
Reviews.Content: First the positive..Front door - clean - bus stops right outside - manager first impression - okay ! Sheets and duvet CLEAN ! Now the bad news !!!! room small , managable no bedside table.Room COLD ! radiator leaking, obvious due to staining of pipe and carpet soaked...Window left open on arrival, fan in window not available but let in cold air ALL NIGHT !! Breakfast choice of toast or toast with jam or jam, with instant coffee, I saw no tea .When I told the manager he said quote '' You should have told me last night I would have changed rooms, You can stay tonight for free '' When I told him we cannot stay another night maybe next time we book then we can stay for free '' When the thames freezes over... will we stay there again !!!......Made a travelodge look like Five star !!

Reviews.Title: “Ok...”
Reviews.Author: faricas
Reviews.Content: Small hotel. Nice location near Victoria station wich is good if you arrive at Gatwick. Bus 14 at the door, very convinient to go to Westminster and Soho in 15/20 minutes. Small Room and bathroom. Breakfast is verysimple (only toasts, butter and jam). Staff could be more polite.

Reviews.Title: “Where is the amiability?”
Reviews.Author: dahuix
Reviews.Content: The start was not how we spected,we booked 2 rooms,we were 4,and they gave us only 1 for 4 persons...small,really small.We payd for 2 separated rooms. The man who was working there,promised us to change the next day early morning into 2 double rooms.But the surprise was that he didnt remember about this and nothing was planned.He said:"go make the day,and when you come back everything would be changed" ...no way,we had to move hotel!!!crazy,no sorry,nothing,we have to move because our other room for 4 people,they gave to other guests!!!amazing,really amazing. When we asked our money back -cause we didnt want to spend the last night there,to dont move again-they was telling us that is not possible.We still dont know why. Sure,if we had the correct rooms at the beggining,maybe the stay would have been perfect...unfortunatly "the boss" was not ready to "fix" the problem and he was really rude or he didn't seem sympathic. Breakfast very simple and rooms with smoke smell...We dindt like it at all.Bu the other hotel that we had to move,was nice,biggers rooms and more complete breakfast. We missed a lot a "sorry" but nothing.....pity.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Basic Hotel-dont expect much”
Reviews.Author: Mash18
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on a block full of hotels. We only like stayed at this hotel because all the other hotels nearby had no vacancies and we booked our trip very late. The positives: its in a good location, about a 5-10 minute walk to the Victoria Station and right near restaurants and pubs (as well as a bus stop right outside of the hotel). Its on a very quiet and pretty block and the staff is friendly. So about the rooms: they are very basic.. tiny tiny bathroom (our drain wasnt working so our little shower kept flooding), little to no space for your luggage, only 1 sheet separating you and the mattress, some of the towels looked dirty (like they had been used for the past 3 years). Also no elevator, so if your room is on the 5th floor prepare to lug your suitcases up 10 flights of stairs. They include breakfast but its basically toast and cereal. The price is reasonable, but compared to other hotels around the area it is a little expensive for what you get. If i had to do it over again I would definitely try to get another hotel in the area, as I am sure there is better.

Reviews.Title: “Never again !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Isleofwightjohn_9
Reviews.Content: Don't have enough space for the bad things. Staff were nice location was good but everything else was very poor !!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very very basic.”
Reviews.Author: leghzielelias
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Lidos hotel for 2 nights in at the beginning of July 2008 with my family. The hotel is extremely basic, but in a good location, in the middle of Belgrave Road, a 7 min. walk from Victoria Station, so in that area there are all the facilities a tourist could need I booked a triple room by e-mail, the cost isn't so high for the location and the service, and the room is enough clean although the curtains are filthy and they give you only one towel per person. The breakfast that they serve in the morning is extremely poor: Bread, Jam and coffee. The remote control of the TV isn't working. The balcony is communicating with another room of the next hotel. There isn't Wi-fi connection, but this is not a problem because London is full of free hotspots. I would suggest this hotel if you don't want to spend a lot. Don't expect anything fancy.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best, but great location”
Reviews.Author: Liz9872991
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with friends during the Christmas holidays. It looked like a quaint little place from the outside, but was certainly aged on the inside. There is no lift so we had to carry our suitcases to our basement level room. The room was small, not that big of a deal since it is not uncommon in Europe, however it was not very clean. The radiator worked well and we stayed warm despite the very chilly weather. The bathroom was awful. That was probably one of the worst I have seen. Very small and not clean. The trash was not changed regularly and the shower hose did not work. The breakfast was basic, but free so it was good enough. It included cork flakes, all of the tea or coffee and toast you could stand, and orange juice. The staff was good or bad depending on the time of day. The location was excellent. It was a short walk to Victoria station, and the locations for Grayline and Evan Evans tour companies and the bus stop was literally outside the hotel's front door so all of the city was easily accessible.

Reviews.Title: “Very Basic”
Reviews.Author: ScrumpyDevon
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 1 night (thankfully) stay at the Lodos. The hotel staff were very nice and friendly and after hiking to the 3rd floor was a little disappointed with the overall state of the room. I knew it was going to be basic from the price we paid, but did not expect to find the curtains would not pull to join each other, and a tangled piece of metal protruding into the room from the broken spring of the sash window balance, a small double bed, a single bed and a bunk bed, with a single wardrobe so close to the entrance door it would not open more than about 45deg. The shower and toilet cubicle was 'tired' and not to clean, the shower curtain was hanging from 3 or 4 hooks that did not slide, but, when we went to shower this was not a problem as there was no COLD water at all, only very hot. So only a strip wash from the basin after the water had cooled enough to dip your hands in. The breakfast was plentifull, fruit juice, loads of toast and jam's, only a choice of 'cornflakes or cornflakes' and plenty of tea or coffee. The breakfast room was so small that when we left other guests were sat on the stairs waiting for the next empty table. So if you want really cheap and cheerfull, go for it. It was the first 'cheapie' for me and will be my last.

Reviews.Title: “Gross”
Reviews.Author: Scaldy
Reviews.Content: When booking I knew it wasn't going to be fancy but I expected it to be at least clean. The staff were very friendly and it's ideally located right beside Victoria Station. Our room looked fine on first glance but then I realised the carpet looked like it hadn't been hoovered in 5 months and when I had a shower it hadn't been cleaned. I had the delight of showering in a shower with pubic hair all over the walls. The shower head was fixed to the wall so I couldn't wash the hair away.The plug hole was completely blocked (by what I suspect were more pubes) which meant it over -flowed all over the bathroom floor. The pole on which the shower curtain hung was completely lopsided so I couldn't pull back the curtain without it sliding back. Needless to say I didn't have another shower for the remainder of my stay. If the room had been cleaned initially there wouldn't have been any problems. It's a shame as the staff were most pleasant and helpful.
